[+1709] 7 Reasons to Keep Dinosaurs Off Drugs
item.description: This is why a tyrannosaurus should never smoke crack.

item.title: [+1692] 10 OS X Pranks That'll Get You Beat Up--or Fired
item.description: If you're thinking to yourself, "Wait, it's not April." Don't worry, we know exactly what we're doing here. Everyone expects pranks in April and the days leading up. Now expects a prank in the middle of summer. Muhahahahahahaa...

item.title: [+1617] Man survives 300 days with knife and pig
item.description: With just two knives for cutting and a baby pig for company, Xavier Rosset sat solo on an uninhabited Pacific island for 300 lonely days.

item.title: [+1497] Hid.im Converts Torrents into PNG Images
item.description: Hid.im is a new web-based service that allows users to hide .torrent files inside PNG images. This means that users can easily upload hidden torrent files to their favorite image hosting service and forums, or use it as an avatar on social networking sites without being censored.

item.title: [+1351] Soldier: Obama not U.S. born, can't send me to Afghanistan
item.description: U.S. Army Maj. Stefan Frederick Cook is seeking a federal court order to stall and eventually prevent an upcoming deployment to Afghanistan.

item.title: [+1179] Here’s What Our Energy Grid Looks Like.
item.description: You’ve probably heard about our outdated energy grid and the need to create a new, “smart” one. Here’s what the problem—and a possible solution—look like.

item.title: [+1053] Breaking: School Board Overreacts
item.description: The “braintrust” running Walkersville High School in Frederick County (MD) have lost their damn minds. They fired their girls’ softball coach after he hosted a team party where alcohol was served…wait for it…TO THE PARENTS.

[+836] Why You Can't Complain About the Price of Today's Gadgets
item.description: So your MacBook cost $1500—boo hoo. Thirty years ago, when the average salary was under $18,000, you'd have paid $2638 for an Apple II with 48K of RAM ($7770 in today's dollars). And a cellphone? Waaaay more.

item.title: [+809] How 16 Famous Electronics Companies Got Their Names
item.description: Most of us spend a lot of time staring at a computer or TV screen, playing video games, or gabbing into our cell phones. The brand names for these products are all familiar, but where did they come from in the first place? Just what is a Nokia? Hereâ��s a look at the origins of some of your favorite tech and gadget companiesâ�� names.

item.title: [+803] Pelosi Puts a Stop to Resolution Honoring Michael Jackson
item.description: "In case you haven't heard the news already, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi killed House Resolution 600 aka the "Michael Jackson Bill" late last week stating emphatically that she didn't think it was necessary."
